snippet: A law enacted Wednesday contradicts the 24-week limit established by the Supreme Court, and abortion rights groups have promised a suit to block the ban before it goes into effect.
abstract: Arkansas adopts a ban on abortion at 12 weeks of pregnancy, the most restrictive in the country; abortion rights groups promise a lawsuit to block the ban, which contradicts the limit established by the Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: A law enacted Wednesday contradicts the 24-week limit established by the Supreme Court, and abortion rights groups have promised a suit to block the ban before it goes into effect.

headline.main: Arkansas Adopts a Ban on Abortions After 12 Weeks
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Adopts A 12-Week Limit For Abortions
